glsa.title: OpenLDAP: Denial of Service vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A flaw in OpenLDAP allows remote unauthenticated attackers to cause a Denial of Service.

background.p: OpenLDAP Software is an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

description.p: Cameron Hotchkies discovered an error within the parsing of ASN.1 BER encoded packets in the "ber_get_next()" function in libraries/liblber/io.c.

impact.p: A remote unauthenticated attacker can send a specially crafted ASN.1 BER encoded packet which will trigger the error and cause an "assert()", terminating the "slapd" daemon.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
